snippet: Prosecutors rebutted claims that Mansour J. Arbabsiar, charged with plotting the assassination of a Saudi diplomat, was mentally ill when he submitted to federal interrogation.
abstract: Federal prosecutors file court papers rebutting defense argument that Iranian-American Mansour J Arbabsiar, charged in a plot to assassinate the Saudi ambassador to the United States, was suffering from mental illness when he knowingly consented to questioning without a lawyer; prosecutors argue that defense motion to suppress Arbasiar's statements should be rejected.
lead_paragraph: Prosecutors rebutted claims that Mansour J. Arbabsiar, charged with plotting the assassination of a Saudi diplomat, was mentally ill when he submitted to federal interrogation.

headline.seo: Man Accused in Murder Plot Was Sane When Questioned, U.S. Says
headline.main: Man Accused of Plot on Envoy Wasn’t Mentally Ill, U.S. Argues
headline.print_headline: Man Accused of Plot on Envoy Wasn’t Mentally Ill, U.S. Argues
